description: From Old French solemnisier, from Medieval Latin solemnizare, from Latin solemnis.

verbs.description: solemnize (third-person singular simple present solemnizes, present participle solemnizing, simple past and past participle solemnized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, US) To make solemn, or official, through ceremony or legal act.
examples: The couple chose to solemnize their relationship in a secular ceremony, instead of having a wedding.

entries.meaning: To make grave, serious, and reverential.
examples: Wordsworth was solemnized and elevated by this his first look on Yarrow.
